messages.subject: Re: new to Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... You might also read sandradodd.com/unschooling/benrules specifically related to rules vs. principles...and then browse around the rest of the links on the
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "neamonn" <neamonn@...>
wrote:
>
> hello my name is Natalie...I am new to the idea of
> unschooling..another mom friend is encouraging me to learn as much
>as
> I can being that she has begun to unschool her 3 children.. since my
> husband and I are not sure what kind of "education" we want to try
> with our children...we have a 2yr old boy named Cedar and a 5 month
> old boy named Orein...I guess I woule love some clarity on
> what "rules" are in one house!? No rules meaing do what ever
> whenever??/ would love some clarification!!! as well as simply the
> bascu info on unschooling!! Thanks, I can assume this question is
> asled wat too much so bear with another new mom member!!!!!
>
You might also read sandradodd.com/unschooling/benrules specifically
related to rules vs. principles...and then browse around the rest of
the links on the unschooling page there (stuff on TV, food, bedtimes,
and more).

--Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: new to Unschooling
messages.messageBody:
yeah that was it! :)

I am new.....reading all I can, and hope to participate more in the
future. My daughters are now 2 and 4 years old.
Thank you all for sharing so much.
Lisa

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] new to Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Natalie, you might want to read here: http://home.earthlink.net/%7Efetteroll/ rejoycing/ There you can find very much information on how this no rules
messages.messageBody:
Hello Natalie,

you might want to read here: http://home.earthlink.net/%7Efetteroll/
rejoycing/

There you can find very much information on how this "no rules"
works. It is kind of a "best-of" of things posted here (and maybe
elsewhere). I found if very helpful at the beginning :-)

I'm sure you will get more answers here as well, I don't mean to say
"go read elsewhere first" ;-) I'm a newbie as well and can't offer so
much information...

Greetings
Johanna


> I guess I woule love some clarity on
> what "rules" are in one house!? No rules meaing do what ever
> whenever??/ would love some clarification!!! as well as simply the
> bascu info on unschooling!! Thanks, I can assume this question is
> asled wat too much so bear with another new mom member!!!!!
>
>
>

messages.messageBody:
hello my name is Natalie...I am new to the idea of
unschooling..another mom friend is encouraging me to learn as much as
I can being that she has begun to unschool her 3 children.. since my
husband and I are not sure what kind of "education" we want to try
with our children...we have a 2yr old boy named Cedar and a 5 month
old boy named Orein...I guess I woule love some clarity on
what "rules" are in one house!? No rules meaing do what ever
whenever??/ would love some clarification!!! as well as simply the
bascu info on unschooling!! Thanks, I can assume this question is
asled wat too much so bear with another new mom member!!!!!
